channel.title: Restricting Player Passwords?
channel.description: Is it possible to restrict a players password? Because of language/length ?

item.title: Restricting Player Passwords?
item.dc:creator: @killa4444 killa4444
item.description:
@killa4444 wrote:

Eh, I figured that most Syi users start with defult password… so i wonder if i can screw at least one of them over…

it seems like this guys keeps using SYIpkpker as his pass… and since he can change is name its useless for me to actually make a restriction on names… yet he always has SYIpkpker as his pass… and thats it seems to have remained constant…

therefore i decided either he doesnt know how to change his pass or it doesnt let him… either way it can only help me

Read full topic

item.title: Restricting Player Passwords?
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

It works for me

/**
 * Created by IntelliJ IDEA.
 * Author: x Blitz x
 * Date: 15-Aug-2008
 * Time: 14:30:50
 */
public class lengthExample {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        String helloWorld = "Hello Worlda";
        //Hello = 5
        //Space = 1
        //World = 5
        if(helloWorld.length() == 11)
            System.out.println("Length: " + helloWorld.length());
        else
            System.out.println("Length: a " + helloWorld.length());
            return;
    }
}

Checks if the length of helloWorld is 11, if it is
Display

Length: length
if it isnt
display
Length: a length

Read full topic

item.title: Restricting Player Passwords?
item.dc:creator: @_Vengeance _Vengeance
item.description:
@_Vengeance wrote:

That wouldn’t come close to compiling.

  1. The ‘length’ value of a String is obtained using the length() method.
  2. if(helloWorld.length = 11)
  3. There is no point of that even being there.

And killa: Why would you need to restrict passwords? Just check them on creation of the account and force them to choose another one if it’s inappropriate.

Read full topic

item.title: Restricting Player Passwords?
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

Yes, use “length” to check the length and put it into a if statment just before login. (run Method)
here is an example

public static void main(String[] args)
{
String helloWorld = "hello world";
//Hello = 5
//Space = 1
//World = 5
//Total Length = 11
System.out.println("Length: " + helloWorld.length());
}

That would print
Length: 11

So to check the length you would use.

public static void main(String[] args)
{
String helloWorld = "hello world";
//Hello = 5
//Space = 1
//World = 5
//Total Length = 11
if(helloWorld.length() == 11)
    System.out.println("Length: " + helloWorld.length());
else
    return;
}

That checks to make sure the length is 11, if it isnt, the program will end.

Read full topic
